DOC.brief_summary: This study is necessary in order to provide proof the effectiveness of Chlorhexidine gluconate and its safety.
DOC.brief_title: Efficacy of Two Vaginal Solutions in Preoperative Use
DOC.detailed_description: It is well known from the literature that the use of Povidone-iodone based solution for vaginal preparation before surgery is fraught with side effects and sensitivity, and often does not provide sufficient eradication of colonies of pathogens from the operation field. It is also known that Chlorhexidine gluconate in low concentration provides a better result and does not cause side effects more than Povidone-iodone, but the chlorhexidine is still not approved for washing the mucous membranes. This study is necessary in order to provide proof of its effectiveness and safety.
DOC.criteria: 1. Patients over the age of 18 2. Candidates for surgery (TOT Trans Obturator Tape, cystoscopy, the introduction / removal of the stent the ureter, ureteroscopy), local or general anesthesia. 1. A pregnant woman or postpartum. 2. A woman with known sensitivity to iodine, povidon or chlorhexidine. 3. Previous pelvic surgeries within three months from the surgery planned. 4. Patients taking antibiotics within one month from the surgery planned. 5. Immunological failure patients. 6. Patient unwilling to participate in the study. 7. Patients who require the appointment of a guardian condition 8. Women assigned to undergo a regular cystoscopy (no further action).
